key_risks: Financial and operational collapse due to inability to sustain business operations
Product reliability issues with zinc-bromine flow batteries failing shortly after installation
Vulnerability to supply chain disruptions and intense market competition
Regulatory and political risks in a rapidly evolving energy policy environment
controversies: High-profile visits by Labor politicians linked to the company's collapse
Customers left dissatisfied and out of pocket due to product failures
environmental_issues: Despite environmental benefits, the company's collapse raises concerns about the sustainability of its technology
social_issues: Customer dissatisfaction and financial losses due to unreliable products
governance_issues: Failure to effectively scale operations and address product reliability issues
Appointment of voluntary administrators indicating governance challenges

sources.title: Administrators fail to recharge battery maker Redflow
sources.snippet: Queensland-based Redflow created a scalable zinc-bromine flow battery designed for energy storage.. The company says its battery is the "world's smallest and most scalable" from tens of kilowatt hours up to hundreds of megawatt hours.. Redflow was planning to develop a larger scale X10 battery (based on its existing stack design) targeted at larger megawatt hour scale projects.
